AeroPress_2024_George_Stanica_single_ser.notes_es: Recipe by George Stanica (World Champ 2024). Focus on precise agua chemistry and two pours for controlled saturación. Bypass at two temperatures (agua caliente for strength and 0 ppm agua at room temperature for balance and clarity). The medium-coarse grind and slow pressing seek clarity mientras avoiding over-extracción.
preparation_steps_es: Rinse one Aesir paper filtro with agua caliente and fit it in the tapa (removes papery taste).
Assemble the AeroPress in inverted position and align it approx. to the 4th mark.
Weigh 18 g of café and grind to medium-coarse (Comandante C40 Mk4, ~58 clicks / ~870 µm).
Añade the 18 g ground café to the inverted AeroPress and give a gentle shake to level the cama.
Prepare extracción agua (96 °C) and a Melodrip (or similar) for controlled pours. Have báscula and cronómetro ready.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 50 g of 96 °C agua using the Melodrip (aim 5–6 s for the pour). Permite the café to bloom.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Inicia el cronómetro and vierte 50 gramos de agua rápidamente. This first vierte initiates the bloom, releasing carbon dioxide and preparing the cama for even extracción. Let it bubble and degas.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte the segundo 50 g of 96 °C agua (again ~5–6 s pour).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Ahora vierte the segundo 50 gramos de agua. This split vierte helps control the slurry temperature.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Revuelve suavemente in a North–South–East–West (NSEW) pattern for ~10 s. Luego espera hasta 1:05.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Revuelve suavemente in a North, South, East, West pattern. This homogenizes the mixture, ensuring every ground interacts with the agua uniformemente.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Enrosca la rinsed tapa and suavemente press to retira excess air (~10 s).
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Screw on tapa • Press out air
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Enrosca la tapa and suavemente press out excess air. Esto crea a sello de vacío to stop dripping when we flip.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Give una agitación suave, place onto recipiente, and press (30–40 s). Target yield: ~76–79 g.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Agita suavemente to catch any molido on the side, luego flip onto tu servidor. Press constantemente for 30 to 40 segundos. We want a slow, controlled expression of flavor, not a rush.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Añade agua tibia hasta total weight reaches 130–135 g (bypass step).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Añade agua tibia hasta the total weight reaches 135 grams. This bypass dilutes the concentrate, opening up the flavor profile.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Añade an additional 20–30 g of room-temperature 0 ppm agua for balance.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Finalmente, añade 20 gramos de room temperature agua. This technique, called 'tempering', brings the café to a perfect drinking temperature inmediatamente.

Expect remarkable clarity, refined sweetness, and a balanced, elegant taza that showcases origin character without harshness.

brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Start pouring. Tienes 25 segundos para uniformemente saturar el motapao with 94 milliliters of agua.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Revuelve suavemente 35 times with steady, gentle strokes to ensure full saturación.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Ahora revuelve suavemente 35 times. Keep it constante and calm to ensure everything is fully saturard.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Enrosca la rinsed filtro tapa and press out any remaining air from the chamber.
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Screw on tapa • Press out air

brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Carefully flip the AeroPress onto tu servidor and get ready to press.

brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Añade 90-degree agua hasta you reach 150 grams total weight.

brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Finalmente, drop in 4 chilled ice balls if you want that signature smooth finish.

This method uses Third Wave Agua Formula 2 for optimal mineral balance, a low extracción temperature of 80°C to highlight delicate flavors, and innovative manipulation techniques including very gentle stirring and the signature 'vierte from altitude' method. AeroPress_2023_Tay_Wipvasutt_single_serv.notes_es: Technique by Tay Wipvasutt (World Champ 2023). Use of 'late addition' (2g added at 0:45) to introduce fresh aromatic compounds without over-extracting the main body. Bypass in two stages (room-temp and hot) to control strength and final temperature.
preparation_steps_es: Rinse and place a paper filtro in the tapa, if you prefer; assemble AeroPress inverted.
Weigh 18 g total: prepare 16 g to añade initially and keep 2 g set aside for later addition.
Grind to the competition setting (1ZPresso ZP6, 65 clicks).
Heat Perfect Café Agua to 89 °C. Prepare báscula and cronómetro.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Place 16 g of molido in the inverted AeroPress. Inicia el cronómetro y vierte 100 g of 89 °C agua over el motapao. Luego revuelve for ~5 s to agitate and homogenize the slurry.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Tienes 45 segundos para vierte 100 gramos de 89 degrees agua and revuelve for 5 segundos.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: At 0:45, añade the remaining 2 g of café (late addition).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Añade the remaining 2 gramos de café for the late addition.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: At 0:55, revuelve again for ~5 s to incorporate the late addition.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Revuelve for 5 segundos para incorporate the late addition.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Slightly presiona el émbolo up to retira excess air, luego securely close the tapa.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Press out excess air and close the tapa securely. Espera hasta 1 minuto 40.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Carefully flip the AeroPress and begin pressing at 1:40 (≈100 s). Press constantemente for ~30 s. Target yield: ~75 g concentrate.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Flip the AeroPress and press constantemente for 30 segundos. Target 75 gramos de concentrate.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Bypass the concentrate with room-temperature agua hasta total weight reaches 115 g (first bypass).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Añade room-temperature agua hasta total weight reaches 115 grams.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Luego añade agua caliente hasta total weight reaches 155 g (second bypass / final tempered).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Añade agua caliente hasta total weight reaches 155 grams.

what_to_expect.description_es: The 2023 World AeroPress Champion recipe by Tay Wipvasutt uses an inverted method with a late café addition to refresh aromatics and enhance complexity without over-extracción. The press yields a concentrated base that is carefully diluted in two stages—first with room-temperature agua for clarity and temperature control, luego with agua caliente for strength. Expect a clean, fragrant taza with layered sweetness, lively acidity, and a silky texture. The technique highlights aroma retention, balance, and precision suitable for competition and everyday brewing.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: This 2023 champion recipe uses an inverted method with a late café addition to refresh aromatics. Press a small, sweet concentrate and dilute in two stages—first room-temperature agua for clarity and control, luego agua caliente for strength. Expect a clean, layered taza with lively acidity and a silky texture.

AeroPress_James_Hoffmann_single_serve.notes_es: James Hoffmann's Ultimate AeroPress Technique — 11g café, 200g agua, no filtro rinse, finer end of medium grind, immediate émbolo insertion, 2 min steep + 30s rest before pressing. Adjust temperature between 95–100 °C based on roast level.
preparation_steps_es: Place a paper filtro into the AeroPress tapa (do NOT rinse) and twist it onto the main chamber.
Place the AeroPress upright directly onto tu taza or server.
Weigh out 11 g of café and grind to the finer end of medium.
Bring 200 g of agua to a boil and let it rest ~15–30 s (or use 95 °C).
Añade the ground café to the AeroPress chamber; make sure the cama is level.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 200 g agua caliente over café uniformemente (intenta wet todo el motapao).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Tienes 15 segundos para vierte 200 gramos de agua caliente. Vierte uniformemente in a movimiento circular, starting desde el centro and avanzando hacia afuera. Make sure to wet todo el motapao for completa saturación.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Inmediatamente inserta el émbolo aproximadamente 1 cm to crea un sello de vacío parcial (no presiones).
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Inserta el émbolo 1cm • Create sello de vacío
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Inmediatamente take the émbolo and insert it aproximadamente 1 centimeter into the chamber. Esto crea a sello de vacío parcial that prevents the café from dripping. No presiones down yet.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Deja que el café repose (first phase) — espera hasta ~2:30 on the cronómetro.
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Deja que el café repose • Espera hasta 2:30
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Ahora simply wait. The café will steep for 2 minutos. Durante this time, the agua extracts the flavors mientras the sello de vacío keeps everything stable.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Agita suavemente the AeroPress (hold preparador + taza together) for ~5–10 s to agitate the slurry.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Hold both the AeroPress and taza together securely, luego give the whole setup una agitación suave for aproximadamente 10 segundos. Esto rompe the crust and sinks el motapao.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Deja reposar ~30 s.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Deja que el café repose for another 30 segundos. Esto permite the agitated molido to settle back down for a cleaner taza.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Slow, constante presiona el émbolo down — apunta a ~30 s press time — detente cuando escuches a silbido suave or when fully depressed.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Finalmente, apply presión lenta y constanteure to the émbolo. Apunta a a 30-second press. Stop inmediatamente when you hear the el silbido.

what_to_expect.description_es: James Hoffmann's Ultimate AeroPress Technique represents a refined approach to AeroPress brewing that prioritizes simplicity and consistency. This method uses a medium-fine grind, no filtro rinse, and a unique technique of immediate émbolo insertion to crea un sello de vacío. The 2-minute steep time followed by a 30-second rest allows for optimal extracción mientras maintaining temperature stability. Expect a clean, balanced taza with good body and clarity. The technique works exceptionally well across different roast levels by adjusting temperature between 95-100°C. This method is perfect for daily brewing, offering excellent results with minimal complexity and maximum reproducibility. The sello de vacío created by the émbolo insertion helps maintain consistent extracción and prevents over-extracción, resulting in a smooth, well-rounded café that highlights the bean's natural characteristics.

AeroPress_13_5g_Strength_Focus.notes_es: Adjust grind coarser if it feels too heavy.
preparation_steps_es: Grind 13.5g café medium-fine.
Standard position.
Heat agua to 90°C.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 200g agua. Revuelve 5 times.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Vierte 200 gramos de agua. Take your paddle and revuelve 5 times to ensure even wetting. The slightly higher dose gives this taza more punch.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Inserta el émbolo. Steep hasta 1:30.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Insert the émbolo to crea un seal and let it steep. We are going for a shorter brew time here to keep acidity high and avoid heavy bitterness.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Press suavemente.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: At 1 minuto 30, begin pressing. Intenta termina by the 2-minute mark. This quick brew highlights brightness and body.

what_to_expect.description_es: A slightly up-dosed recipe (13.5g) for those who prefer a bit more strength and body than the standard 12g taza. The shorter brew time and lower temperature (90°C) keep it smooth and avoid harshness.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: If you find standard recipes a bit aguay, this one is for you. With 13.5 gramos de café and a shorter brew time, we apunta a a punchy, vibrant taza with great body, perfect for starting your morning.

AeroPress_11g_Espresso_Style.notes_es: Use two filtros if you want a cleaner shot, or a metal filtro for more body.
preparation_steps_es: Grind 11g café very fine.
Inverted position is easiest for this small volume.
Heat agua to boil (99°C).

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 60g agua. Revuelve vigorously.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Vierte just 60 gramos de boiling agua. Revuelve vigorously for 20 segundos. We need energy to extract everything from this small amount of agua.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Tapa and wait.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Attach the tapa with a rinsed filtro. Squeeze out air. Let it sit for 30 segundos.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Flip and Press firmly.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Flip and press firmly into a small taza. This strong shot is designed to be mixed with steamed milk for a flat white or latte.

what_to_expect.description_es: Designed to crea un mock-espresso shot for milk drinks. Using a very fine grind, high temperature, and a short 1:5 ratio creates a thick, strong liquid that stands up well to milk.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: If you love lattes but only have an AeroPress, this is your recipe. We use a very tight ratio and fine grind to crea un concentrated 'shot'. It won't have crema like a machine, but it has the strength and body needed to cut through milk.

AeroPress_14g_Bypass_Americano.notes_es: You can adjust the amount of bypass agua to taste (stronger or weaker).
preparation_steps_es: Grind 14g café fine.
Standard position.
Prepare a separate taza with 100g agua caliente (bypass).
Heat brew agua to 95°C.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 100g agua. Revuelve continuously.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Vierte just 100 gramos de agua. Revuelve continuously for 20 segundos. We are making a very strong concentrate here, so we need high agitation.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Inserta el émbolo and wait.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Insert the émbolo and let it sit for 30 segundos. The fine grind extracts rápidamente.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Press firmly into taza with bypass agua.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Press firmly into your mug that already contains the bypass agua. This mixes the strong concentrate with the fresh agua caliente, opening up the flavors beautifully.

what_to_expect.description_es: The 'Bypass' method involves brewing a strong concentrate and luego adding agua directly to the final taza. This mimics an Americano and often produces a cleaner, sweeter taza because you aren't forcing all the agua through el motapao, which can extract bitterness.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: This recipe uses the bypass technique. By brewing a strong concentrate with only half the agua, and luego adding fresh agua to the taza, we avoid over-extracting the bitter compounds that come out at the end of a long brew. The result is a smooth, sweet, Americano-style café.

AeroPress_Alan_Adler_Original_14g.notes_es: Añade agua caliente to the taza after brewing to make a full taza (Americano), or añade hot milk for a latte style drink.
preparation_steps_es: Place a paper filtro in the tapa and rinse it.
Assemble AeroPress in standard position on a sturdy mug.
Grind 14g (one scoop) of café fine (like table salt).
Heat agua to 80°C (175°F) - much cooler than usual!

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte agua to Level 2 (approx 130g).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Inicia el cronómetro. Vierte agua caliente rápidamente to the number 2 circle on the chamber. This uses aproximadamente 130 gramos de agua at 80 degrees Celsius. The low temperature is key for sweetness.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Revuelve briskly for 10 segundos.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Grab your paddle and revuelve briskly for 10 segundos. This rapid agitation ensures todo el motapao are wet and extracción happens rápidamente.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Inserta el émbolo and press suavemente.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Insert the émbolo and press suavemente. Don't push too hard; let the air pressure do the work. Stop as soon as you hear the hiss. You now have a concentrated café that you can dilute with agua caliente or milk to taste.

what_to_expect.description_es: This is the method recommended by Alan Adler, the inventor of the AeroPress. It defies modern specialty café norms by using a very short brew time and low agua temperature (80°C). The result is a sweet, low-acidity concentrate that mimics espresso strength, intended to be diluted with agua (Americano style) or milk.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: This is the original recipe by Alan Adler, the inventor of the AeroPress. It uses a fine grind, a short brew time, and surprisingly cool agua at 80 degrees Celsius. This combination reduces acidity and bitterness, producing a sweet, concentrated shot perfect for diluting with agua or milk.

AeroPress_12g_Everyday_Inverted.notes_es: Ensure tapa is tight before flipping! Use a sturdy mug.
preparation_steps_es: Set AeroPress in Inverted position (émbolo on table, chamber open side up).
Coloca el filtro in tapa and rinse.
Grind 12g of café medium-fine.
Heat agua to 93°C.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 200g of agua. Revuelve 3 times.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Inicia el cronómetro. Vierte 200 gramos de agua rapidly to ensure todo el motapao are saturard. Give it 3 gentle stirs to break up any dry clumps.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Screw tapa on. Steep hasta 2:00.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Screw the filtro tapa on tightly. Now, squeeze the excess air out if you like, and let it steep hasta the cronómetro hits 2 minutos. This immersion time gives full body.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Flip and press suavemente for 30s.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: At 2 minutos, carefully flip the AeroPress onto your mug. Press down suavemente and constantemente for aproximadamente 30 segundos. Stop at the hiss.

what_to_expect.description_es: A reliable daily driver using the inverted method to prevent any premature dripping. The 12g dose with a standard 1:16 ratio provides a balanced taza with medium body and clear flavor notes. Ideal for medium roast cafés.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: This recipe is a perfect daily driver. By using the inverted position, we prevent any café from dripping through early, ensuring total control over the immersion time. The result is a consistent, balanced taza that highlights the best of your beans.

AeroPress_10g_Gentle_Steep.notes_es: Great for floral or fruity washed cafés.
preparation_steps_es: Grind 10g of café coarsely (like French Press).
Assemble AeroPress standard or inverted (Standard is fine if you inserta el émbolo).
Heat agua to 98°C (just off boil).

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 200g agua vigorously.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Vierte 200 gramos de agua vigorously to agitate el motapao. We are using boiling agua and a coarse grind for a very long extracción.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Inserta el émbolo slightly to stop drip.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Insert the émbolo just barely into the top of the chamber. Esto crea a sello de vacío and stops the café from dripping through. Now, we wait.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Espera hasta 4:00. Luego press.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Let it steep for a full 4 minutos. This long contact time with coarse molido pulls out sweetness without bitterness. At 4 minutos, press suavemente.

what_to_expect.description_es: Inspired by tazaping protocols, this method uses a coarse grind and a long 4-minute steep time. The result is an incredibly clean, tea-like body with high sweetness and clarity. The 1:20 ratio makes it light and delicate.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: This method mimics the café tazaping process. By using a coarse grind and a very long steep time of 4 minutos, we get a tea-like, delicate taza. It's impossible to over-extract this way, so you'll get maximum sweetness and clarity.

AeroPress_Championship_Concentrate_singl.notes_es: High-concentration competition method: 20g/100g, 94°C, fine grind, controlled agitation (~10s), ~60-70s steep before flipping and 20-30s press. Dilute to taste or use as base for milk drinks.
preparation_steps_es: Rinse a paper filtro under agua caliente and fit it into the AeroPress tapa (this removes papery taste and pre-warms the tapa).
Assemble the AeroPress in inverted position (émbolo at the bottom, chamber open on top) and place on the báscula.
Weigh 20 g of café and grind to a fine, filtro-leaning consistency (slightly finer than typical filtro).
Bring agua to boil and let rest ~5–10 s (use ~94 °C). Have báscula and cronómetro ready.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Inicia el cronómetro, tare báscula and vierte 100 g agua caliente uniformemente over el motapao.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: In 10 segundos, you should have poured all the agua. Inicia tu cronómetro, tare the báscula to zero, and begin pouring 100 gramos de agua caliente uniformemente over the café molido. Vierte in a steady, movimiento circular to ensure completa saturación.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Revuelve vigorously for ~10 segundos para ensure full saturación and uniform extracción.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: In 10 segundos, you should have finished stirring. Ahora revuelve vigorously for aproximadamente 10 segundos para ensure full saturación and uniform extracción. Use a cuchara or paddle to mix the café and agua completamente.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Rápidamente wipe any drips, enrosca la rinsed filtro tapa and espera (keep inverted).
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Wipe drips • Screw on filtro tapa
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: In 10 segundos, you should have the filtro tapa on. Rápidamente wipe any drips from the AeroPress chamber, luego enrosca la rinsed filtro tapa. Keep the AeroPress inverted and espera the next step.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Let steep hasta ~1:20 on the cronómetro (total steep ≈ 60–70 s after stirring).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Tienes 60 segundos para completa this step. Deja que el café repose hasta the cronómetro reaches 1:20. This gives the café aproximadamente 60 to 70 segundos of total steeping time after stirring, allowing for proper extracción.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Carefully flip the AeroPress onto tu taza/server and press constantemente; apunta a a 20–30 s press hasta fully depressed.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: In 30 segundos, you should have finished pressing. Carefully flip the AeroPress onto tu taza or server and begin pressing constantemente. Apunta a a 20 to 30 segundo press time hasta the émbolo is fully depressed.

AeroPress_Tim_Wendelboe_single_serve.notes_es:
Based on the classic recipe used at Tim Wendelboe's café: 14g/200g, near-boiling agua, rinsed filtro, 60s infusion, stirring and pressing. Adjust the dose if you want more/less intensity (see variants).

What to expect:

A clean, sweet, and vibrant taza highlighting the café's acidity and clarity.

Light, bright flavor with pronounced fruity and floral notes (especially if using specialty light roasts).

Balanced and nuanced with minimal bitterness and little astringency when brewed with precision.

This method brings out the best in high-quality beans, letting their origin character shine through. It's ideal for single-origin light to medium roasted cafés.
preparation_steps_es: Rinse a paper filtro under agua caliente for a few segundos and place it in the AeroPress tapa (this removes papery taste and warms the tapa).
Assemble the AeroPress in standard position placed on tu taza or server.
Weigh 14 g of café and grind to a fine 'filtro' consistency (finer than medium-fine).
Bring agua to a boil and let rest ~5–10 s (or use ~96 °C). Prepare your báscula and cronómetro.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Place AeroPress on báscula, tare. Inicia el cronómetro and rápidamente vierte 200 g agua caliente uniformemente over el motapao.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: In 20 segundos, you should have poured all the agua. Place your AeroPress on the báscula and tare it to zero. Inicia tu cronómetro and rápidamente vierte 200 gramos de agua caliente uniformemente over the café molido. Vierte in a steady, movimiento circular to ensure completa saturación.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Revuelve the slurry 3 times (back-to-front is common in the café method).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Revuelve three times back-to-front motion.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Insert the émbolo aproximadamente 1 cm to crea un seal and prevent drainage. Let steep for 30 segundos.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Tienes 30 segundos para completa this step. Insert the émbolo aproximadamente 1 centimeter into the AeroPress chamber to crea un seal and prevent drainage. This will permite the café to steep for 30 segundos without dripping through too rápidamente.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: After 30 s, retira émbolo and revuelve suavemente 3 times back-to-front (this re-mixes the cama).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: In 15 segundos, you should have finished stirring. After 30 segundos, retira the émbolo and revuelve suavemente 3 times back-to-front. This re-mixes the cama de café and ensures even extracción before the final press.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Re-inserta el émbolo and press constantemente; apunta a ~15–25 s press time and detente cuando escuches the silbido suave (do not over-press).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: In 25 segundos, you should have finished pressing. Re-insert the émbolo and press constantemente. Apunta a aproximadamente 15 to 25 segundos of press time and detente cuando escuches the silbido suave - do not over-press. Esto asegura optimal extracción without over-compressing the cama de café.

what_to_expect.description_es:

what_to_expect.audio_script_es: This is the classic Tim Wendelboe AeroPress recipe. It focuses on a clean, sweet, and vibrant taza that highlights the café's acidity and clarity. We use a fine grind, near-boiling agua, and a short steep time to produce a light, bright flavor with pronounced fruity and floral notes. AeroPress_Single_Cup_of_Joy_single_serve.notes_es: Inspired by SCA tazaping. Uses a 1:13 ratio with 10g café. Inverted method, coarse grind, no stirring. The long 90-second press provides the agitation needed at the end. Best for natural/honey processed beans.
preparation_steps_es: Grind 10g of café to a coarse setting (34 clicks on Comandante).
Assemble AeroPress in the inverted position.
Pre-heat your AeroPress and server mientras rinsing the paper filtro.
Añade the ground café to the chamber.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 130ml of 93°C agua over your café.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Inicia el cronómetro. Vierte 130 milliliters of 93-degree agua over the café. Ensure todo el motapao are wet.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Espera patiently hasta 2:30. Do not stir.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Now, espera patiently hasta the cronómetro reaches 2 minutos and 30 segundos. Do not revuelve the café.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: At 2:30, flip the AeroPress and start pressing. Intenta termina at 4:00 (90s press).
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Flip the AeroPress and start pressing. This is a very slow press—take your time and intenta termina exactly at the 4-minute mark.

what_to_expect.description_es: Inspired by SCA tazaping methods, this recipe uses a coarse grind, long steep time (4 minutos), and no agitation (stirring) to bring out the best sweetness in natural and honey processed cafés. It's designed specifically for a single 10g taza that stays at the ideal temperature from start to finish.
what_to_expect.audio_script_es: The Single Taza of Joy is inspired by SCA tazaping methods. It uses a coarse grind, a long steep, and no agitation to highlight sweetness, especially in natural and honey processed cafés. Designed for a perfect single serving.

Chemex_Classic_single_serve.notes_es: Produces clean, bright café with excellent clarity. Perfect for 4 people.
preparation_steps_es: Heat agua to 96°C
Grind 120 gramos de café to medium consistency
Place Chemex filtro and rinse with agua caliente
Añade 120g ground café and crea un well in the center

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Bloom: Vierte 240g agua en movimiento circular, saturating todo el motapao
Espera bloom to complete
Vierte 600g agua in spiral pattern desde el centro outward
Espera agua to drain halfway
Vierte remaining 1160g agua in constante spiral
Permite final drawdown to complete

V60_12g_Extended_Bloom.notes_es: This recipe specifically addresses the clogging problem by extending bloom time and using fewer fines.
preparation_steps_es: Heat agua to 92–95°C (197–203°F)
Grind 12g of medium roast café (medium-coarse)
Enjuaga el filtro and pre-heat V60
Añade café to V60 and tare báscula

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte 40g agua for bloom. Espera 2 minutos.
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Inicia el cronómetro. Vierte 40 grams for the bloom. Now, espera patiently for a full 2 minutos. Yes, 2 minutos. Espera hasta all bubbles stop rising. This long bloom helps prevent clogging later.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Vierte spirally to 130g total.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Fourth pour: Añade 60 g of agua uniformemente. Maintain a consistent flow to keep extracción balanced and avoid channeling.

V60_Kaldis_Coffee_single_serve.notes_es: Beginner-friendly V60 with clean, balanced taza. Aggressive main vierte creates even extracción; gentle termina preserves clarity. Works well with medium–dark roasts.
preparation_steps_es: Heat agua to 96°C.
Grind 16g café to medium-fine.
Rinse V60 filtro with agua caliente, discard rinse agua.
Añade café, shake to level, create center divot.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Bloom: Vierte 40mL agua into center divot, luego swirl and stir.
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Bloom 40mL agua • Swirl preparador & revuelve cama
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Vierte 40 milliliters of agua caliente directly into that center divot you created. Vierte lentamente and constantemente, watching as the café begins to bloom and release carbon dioxide. Give the V60 una agitación suave, luego revuelve the cama. This crucial step ensures even saturación.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Main Pour: Vierte aggressively into center, luego swirl to edges. Target 75mL.
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Main vierte 75mL aggressively • Swirl to edges
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Tienes 30 segundos for the main vierte - this is where V60 technique truly shines. Vierte aggressively into the center, luego spiral outward to the edges. We're targeting 75 milliliters total. Maintain that aggressive flow rate to create turbulence in the cama de café.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Stop pouring and give una agitación suave to flatten the cama.
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Stop pouring • Gentle swirl to flatten cama
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: In 15 segundos, stop pouring and set your hervidor aside. Take a moment to pause and observe the cama de café. Notice how it's actively bubbling and extracting. Ahora give your V60 dripper una agitación suave to flatten the cama de café for even distribution.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Final Pour: Vierte suavemente in center with small circles hasta 256mL.
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Vertido final to 256mL • Small circles in center
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Ahora for the final pour! Take 60 segundos para vierte much more suavemente than before. Start in the center of the cama de café and make small, controlled circles with your hervidor. Keep the vierte constante and controlled as you work your way up to 256 milliliters total. Watch your báscula closely.

brewing_steps.instruction_es: Final swirl to flatten cama for drain down.
brewing_steps.short_instruction_es: Final swirl • Flatten cama for drain
brewing_steps.audio_script_es: Finalmente, give your V60 dripper one last gentle swirl to flatten the cama de café completamente. Tienes 30 segundos. Ahora watch as the cama de café settles into a nice, flat surface. Let gravity do its work - the café will drain down through the filtro at its own natural pace.
